wikipedia_page.main: Evan MacColl (Scottish Gaelic: "Eóghann MacColla"; 1808–1898) was a Scots-Canadian Gaelic poet who also produced poems in English. He is commonly known in his native language as Bàrd Loch Fìne (the "Poet of Loch Fyne"). Later he became known as "the Gaelic Bard of Canada".

response: * Evan MacColl – the poet of Loch Fyne
* September 21 – Evan MacColl (died 1898), Scottish-born Canadian poet writing in Scottish Gaelic and English
* July 24 – Evan MacColl (born 1808), Scottish-born Canadian poet writing in Scottish Gaelic and English
* 21 September – Evan MacColl, poet writing in Gaelic and English (died 1898 in Canada)
